page.title: 01 General Review
page.content:
I9UN This area is of a rural nature, taking in two villages,{Aspley Guise and{Husborne Crawley.}It is on the outskirts of the new city of Milton Keynes and lies between the boundaries of Woburn Safari Park to the South and the M1 Motorway. The branch line railway between Bletchley and Bedford runs along the top of the grid squares.
The main topographical features are mixed woodlands and open fields, traversed by a rich network of footpaths. The soil is light and sandy and Bentonite(Fullers Earth) is extracted within the area. The reclamation of these mining works has led to an intensive programme of tree planting.
